div.pre: 1878 South Italy, before 1900? (499) Burial: c. 490 B.C. (K) Contents: 14 incuse AR Metapontum: 6 st. (1 spread as Noe 44; 5 medium incl. N. 97, 131, 176) Sybaris: 4 st. (all with ϒΜ in ex.) Caulonia: 1 st. (as N. 22) Croton: 3 st. (2 spread with QΡΟ over ΤΕ in die and crab symbol; 1 spread with heron symbol) Disposition: E. P. Warren, then London 13 and Lloyd 1 Croton (SNG 593) BM Register of Acquisitions for 1929 Hill, NC 1930, p. 286, illus. (Croton) BMQ 1929-30, p. 101, illus. (Croton) Neither the dates of discovery nor of acquisition by Warren are recorded, but lie may have acquired this hd. at about the same time as his other S. Italian hd., no. 1975 below, namely before 1900
